   20: -module(os_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([space_in_cwd/1, quoting/1, cmd_unicode/1, 
   26:          env/1,
   27:          null_in_command/1, space_in_name/1, bad_command/1,
   28: 	 find_executable/1, unix_comment_in_command/1, deep_list_command/1,
   29:          large_output_command/1, background_command/0, background_command/1,
   30:          message_leak/1, close_stdin/0, close_stdin/1, max_size_command/1,
   31:          perf_counter_api/1, error_info/1, sys_shell/1]).
   32: 
   33: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   34: 
   35: suite() ->
   36:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   37:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   38: 
   39: all() ->
   40:     [space_in_cwd, quoting, cmd_unicode, null_in_command,
   41:      space_in_name, bad_command,
   42:      env,
   43:      find_executable, unix_comment_in_command, deep_list_command,
   44:      large_output_command, background_command, message_leak,
   45:      close_stdin, max_size_command, perf_counter_api,
   46:      error_info, sys_shell].
   47: 
   48: groups() ->
   49:     [].
   50: 
   51: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   52:     Config.
   53: 
   54: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   55:     ok.
   56: 
   57: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   61:     Config.
   62: 
   63: init_per_testcase(TC, Config)
   64:   when TC =:= background_command; TC =:= close_stdin; TC =:= sys_shell ->
   65:     case os:type() of
   66:         {win32, _} ->
   67:             {skip,"Should not work on windows"};
   68:         _ ->
   69:             Config
   70:     end;
   71: init_per_testcase(_TC,Config) ->
   72:     Config.
   73: 
   74: end_per_testcase(_,_Config) ->
   75:     ok.
   76: 
   77: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   78:     Env0 = os:env(),
   79:     GetEnv0 = os:getenv(),
   80:     lists:foldl(fun({K,V}, [KV | T]) ->
   81:                         KV = K ++ "=" ++ V,
   82:                         V = os:getenv(K),
   83:                         V = os:getenv(K, default),
   84:                         T
   85:                 end,
   86:                 GetEnv0,
   87:                 Env0),
   88:     ok.
   89: 
   90: %% Test that executing a command in a current working directory
   91: %% with space in its name works.
   92: space_in_cwd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   93:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   94:     Dirname = filename:join(PrivDir, "cwd with space"),
   95:     ok = file:make_dir(Dirname),
   96:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dirname),
   97: 
   98:     %% Using `more' gives the almost the same result on both Unix and Windows.
   99: 
  100:     Cmd = case os:type() of
  101: 	      {win32, _} ->
  102: 		  "more";
  103: 	      {unix, _} ->
  104: 		  "more </dev/null"
  105: 	  end,
  106: 
  107:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  108: 	[] -> ok;				% Unix.
  109: 	"\r\n" -> ok;			% Windows.
  110: 	Other ->
  111: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  112:     end,
  113: 
  114:     ct:sleep(5),
  115:     [] = receive_all(),
  116:     ok.
  117: 
  118: %% Test that various ways of quoting arguments work.
  119: quoting(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  120:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  121:     Echo = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo"),
  122: 
  123:     comp("one", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one")),
  124:     comp("one::two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one two")),
  125:     comp("one two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " \"one two\"")),
  126:     comp("x::one two::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"one two\" y")),
  127:     comp("x::one two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"one two\"")),
  128:     comp("one two::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " \"one two\" y")),
  129:     comp("x::::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"\" y")),
  130:     ct:sleep(5),
  131:     [] = receive_all(),
  132:     ok.
  133: 
  134: 
  135: %% Test that unicode arguments work.
  136: cmd_unicode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  137:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  138:     Echo = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo"),
  139: 
  140:     comp("one", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one")),
  141:     comp("one::two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one two")),
  142:     comp("åäö::ϼΩ", os:cmd(Echo ++ " åäö " ++ [1020, 937])),
  143:     ct:sleep(5),
  144:     [] = receive_all(),
  145:     ok.
  146: 
  147: null_in_command(_Config) ->
  148:     {Ok, Error} = case os:type() of
  149:                       {win32,_} -> {"dir", "di\0r"};
  150:                       _ -> {"ls", "l\0s"}
  151:                   end,
  152:     true = is_list(try os:cmd(Ok) catch Class0:_ -> Class0 end),
  153:     error = try os:cmd(Error) catch Class1:_ -> Class1 end,
  154:     ok.
  155: 
  156: %% Test that program with a space in its name can be executed.
  157: space_in_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  158:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  159:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  160:     Spacedir = filename:join(PrivDir, "program files"),
  161:     Ext = case os:type() of
  162: 	      {win32,_} -> ".exe";
  163: 	      _ -> ""
  164: 	  end,
  165:     OrigEcho = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo" ++ Ext),
  166:     Echo0 = filename:join(Spacedir, "my_echo" ++ Ext),
  167: 
  168:     %% Copy the `my_echo' program to a directory whose name contains a space.
  169: 
  170:     ok = file:make_dir(Spacedir),
  171:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(OrigEcho),
  172:     ok = file:write_file(Echo0, Bin),
  173:     Echo = filename:nativename(Echo0),
  174:     ok = file:change_mode(Echo, 8#777),	% Make it executable on Unix.
  175: 
  176:     %% Run the echo program.
  177:     %% Quoting on windows depends on if the full path of the executable
  178:     %% contains special characters. Paths when running common_tests always
  179:     %% include @, why Windows would always fail if we do not double the
  180:     %% quotes (this is the behaviour of cmd.exe, not Erlang's idea).
  181:     Quote = case os:type() of
  182:                 {win32,_} ->
  183: 		    case (Echo -- "&<>()@^|") =:= Echo of
  184: 		        true -> "\"";
  185: 			false -> "\"\""
  186: 	 	    end;
  187: 		_ ->
  188: 		    "\""
  189: 	    end,
  190:     comp("", os:cmd(Quote ++ Echo ++ Quote)),
  191:     comp("a::b::c", os:cmd(Quote ++ Echo ++ Quote ++ " a b c")),
  192:     ct:sleep(5),
  193:     [] = receive_all(),
  194:     ok.
  195: 
  196: %% Check that a bad command doesn't crasch the server or the emulator (it used to).
  197: bad_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  198:     catch os:cmd([a|b]),
  199:     catch os:cmd({bad, thing}),
  200: 
  201:     %% This should at least not crash (on Unix it typically returns
  202:     %% a message from the shell).
  203:     os:cmd("xxxxx"),
  204: 
  205:     ok.
  206: 
  207: find_executable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  208:     case os:type() of
  209: 	{win32, _} ->
  210: 	    DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "win32"),
  211: 	    ok = file:set_cwd(filename:join([DataDir, "current"])),
  212: 	    Bin = filename:join(DataDir, "bin"),
  213: 	    Abin = filename:join(DataDir, "abin"),
  214: 	    UsrBin = filename:join([DataDir, "usr", "bin"]),
  215: 	    {ok, Current} = file:get_cwd(),
  216: 
  217: 	    Path = lists:concat([Bin, ";", Abin, ";", UsrBin]),
  218: 	    io:format("Path = ~s", [Path]),
  219: 
  220: 	    %% Search for programs in Bin (second element in PATH).
  221: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar", ".exe", Path),
  222: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii", ".com", Path),
  223: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb", ".bat", Path),
  224: 	    %% OTP-3626 find names of executables given with extension
  225: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar.exe", "", Path),
  226: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii.com", "", Path),
  227: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb.bat", "", Path),
  228: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar.EXE", "", Path),
  229: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii.COM", "", Path),
  230: 	    find_exe(Abin, "MY_ADB.BAT", "", Path),
  231: 
  232: 	    %% Search for programs in Abin (second element in PATH).
  233: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar", ".exe", Path),
  234: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii", ".com", Path),
  235: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb", ".bat", Path),
  236: 
  237: 	    %% Search for programs in the current working directory.
  238: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_program", ".exe", Path),
  239: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_command", ".com", Path),
  240: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_batch", ".bat", Path),
  241: 	    ok;
  242: 	{unix, _}  ->
  243: 	    DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  244: 
  245: 	    %% Smoke test.
  246: 	    case ct:get_progname() of
  247: 		"erl" ->
  248: 		    ErlPath = os:find_executable("erl"),
  249: 		    true = is_list(ErlPath),
  250: 		    true = filelib:is_regular(ErlPath);
  251: 		_ ->
  252: 		    %% Don't bother -- the progname could include options.
  253: 		    ok
  254: 	    end,
  255: 
  256: 	    %% Never return a directory name.
  257: 	    false = os:find_executable("unix", [DataDir]),
  258: 	    ok
  259:     end.
  260: 
  261: find_exe(Where, Name, Ext, Path) ->
  262:     Expected = filename:join(Where, Name++Ext),
  263:     case os:find_executable(Name, Path) of
  264: 	Expected ->
  265: 	    ok;
  266: 	Name when is_list(Name) ->
  267: 	    case filename:absname(Name) of
  268: 		Expected ->
  269: 		    ok;
  270: 		Other ->
  271: 		    io:format("Expected ~p; got (converted to absolute) ~p",
  272: 			      [Expected, Other]),
  273: 		    ct:fail(failed)
  274: 	    end;
  275: 	Other ->
  276: 	    io:format("Expected ~p; got ~p", [Expected, Other]),
  277: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  278:     end.
  279: 
  280: %% OTP-1805: Test that os:cmd(\ls #\) works correctly (used to hang).
  281: unix_comment_in_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  282:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  283:     ok = file:set_cwd(Priv),
  284:     _ = os:cmd("ls #"),			% Any result is ok.
  285:     ct:sleep(5),
  286:     [] = receive_all(),
  287:     ok.
  288: 
  289: %% Check that a deep list in command works equally on unix and on windows.
  290: deep_list_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  291:     %% As a 'io_lib' module description says: "There is no guarantee that the
  292:     %% character lists returned from some of the functions are flat, they can
  293:     %% be deep lists."
  294:     %% That's why os:cmd/1 can have arguments that are deep lists.
  295:     %% It is not a problem for unix, but for windows it is (in R15B02 for ex.).
  296:     Echo = os:cmd([$e, $c, "ho"]),
  297:     true = erlang:is_list(Echo),
  298:     %% FYI: [$e, $c, "ho"] =:= io_lib:format("ec~s", ["ho"])
  299:     ok.
  300: 
  301: %% Test to make sure that the correct data is
  302: %% received when doing large commands.
  303: large_output_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304:     %% Maximum allowed on windows is 8192, so we test well below that
  305:     AAA = lists:duplicate(7000, $a),
  306:     comp(AAA,os:cmd("echo " ++ AAA)).
  307: 
  308: %% Test that it is possible on unix to start a background task using os:cmd.
  309: background_command() ->
  310:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 5}}].
  311: background_command(_Config) ->
  312:     %% This testcase fails when the os:cmd takes
  313:     %% longer then the 5 second timeout
  314:     os:cmd("sleep 10&").
  315: 
  316: %% Test that message does not leak to the calling process
  317: message_leak(_Config) ->
  318:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  319: 
  320:     os:cmd("echo hello"),
  321:     [] = receive_all(),
  322: 
  323:     case os:type() of
  324:         {unix, _} ->
  325:             os:cmd("for i in $(seq 1 100); do echo hello; done&"),
  326:             [] = receive_all();
  327:         _ ->
  328:             ok % Cannot background on non-unix
  329:     end,
  330: 
  331:     process_flag(trap_exit, false).
  332: 
  333: %% Test that os:cmd closes stdin of the program that is executed
  334: close_stdin() ->
  335:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 5}}].
  336: close_stdin(Config) ->
  337:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  338:     Fds = filename:join(DataDir, "my_fds"),
  339: 
  340:     "0" = os:cmd(Fds).
  341: 
  342: max_size_command(_Config) ->
  343:     WSL = case os:getenv("WSLENV") of
  344:               false -> "";
  345:               _ -> "wsl "
  346:           end,
  347: 
  348:     Res20 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 20 }),
  349:     20 = length(Res20),
  350: 
  351:     Res0 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 0 }),
  352:     0 = length(Res0),
  353: 
  354:     Res32768 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 32768 }),
  355:     32768 = length(Res32768),
  356: 
  357:     ResHello = string:trim(os:cmd("echo hello", #{ max_size => 20 })),
  358:     5 = length(ResHello).
  359: 
  360: %% Test that the os:perf_counter api works as expected
  361: perf_counter_api(_Config) ->
  362: 
  363:     true = is_integer(os:perf_counter()),
  364:     true = os:perf_counter() > 0,
  365: 
  366:     Conv = fun(T1, T2) ->
  367:                    erlang:convert_time_unit(T2 - T1, perf_counter, nanosecond)
  368:            end,
  369: 
  370:     do_perf_counter_test([], Conv, 120000000, 80000000),
  371:     do_perf_counter_test([1000], fun(T1, T2) -> T2 - T1 end, 120, 80).
  372: 
  373: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower) ->
  374:     %% We run the test multiple times to try to get a somewhat
  375:     %% stable value... what does this test? That the
  376:     %% calculate_perf_counter_unit in sys_time.c works somewhat ok.
  377:     do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, 10).
  378: 
  379: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, _Conv, Upper, Lower, 0) ->
  380:     ct:fail("perf_counter_test ~p ~p ~p",[CntArgs, Upper, Lower]);
  381: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, Iters) ->
  382: 
  383:     T1 = apply(os, perf_counter, CntArgs),
  384:     timer:sleep(100),
  385:     T2 = apply(os, perf_counter, CntArgs),
  386:     TsDiff = Conv(T1, T2),
  387:     ct:log("T1: ~p~n"
  388:            "T2: ~p~n"
  389:            "TsDiff: ~p~n",
  390:            [T1,T2,TsDiff]),
  391: 
  392:     if
  393:         TsDiff < Upper, TsDiff > Lower ->
  394:             ok;
  395:         true ->
  396:             do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, Iters-1)
  397:     end.
  398: 
  399: error_info(Config) ->
  400: 
  401: 
  402:     ExhaustFDs =
  403:         fun(M,F,A) ->
  404:                 case no_limit_for_opened_files() of
  405:                     false ->
  406:                         {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  407:                         FN = filename:join(
  408:                                proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  409:                                "error_info"),
  410:                         try
  411:                             erpc:call(
  412:                               Node,
  413:                               fun() ->
  414:                                       io:format("Starting to open files..."),
  415:                                       (fun FDs(N) ->
  416:                                                case file:open(FN, [write]) of
  417:                                                    {ok, _ } -> FDs(N+1);
  418:                                                    {error, _} ->
  419:                                                        io:format("Opened ~p files",[N])
  420:                                                end
  421:                                        end)(0),
  422:                                       apply(M,F,A)
  423:                               end)
  424:                         catch error:{exception, ErrorReason, StackTrace} ->
  425:                                 erlang:raise(error, ErrorReason, StackTrace)
  426:                         after
  427:                             peer:stop(Peer)
  428:                         end;
  429:                     true ->
  430:                         apply(M,F,A)
  431:                 end
  432:         end,
  433: 
  434:     L = [{cmd, [{no, string}]},
  435:          {cmd, [["echo 1",0,0,0,1]]},
  436:          {cmd, [{no, string}, #{}]},
  437:          {cmd, [{no, string}, no_map]},
  438:          {cmd, ["echo 1"], [{general, "too many open files \\(emfile\\)"},
  439:                             {wrapper, ExhaustFDs}] ++
  440:               [no_fail || no_limit_for_opened_files()]},
  441: 
  442:          {find_executable, 1},                  %Not a BIF.
  443:          {find_executable, 2},                  %Not a BIF.
  444: 
  445:          {getenv, [a]},
  446:          {getenv, [[<<"bin">>]]},
  447:          {getenv, [[-1]]},
  448:          {getenv, [[999999999999999]]},
  449:          {getenv, [["abc"|improper_tail]]},
  450:          {getenv, ["abc="]},
  451:          {getenv, ["abc\0xyz"]},
  452: 
  453:          {getenv,[a, default]},
  454: 
  455:          {perf_counter,[bad_time_unit]},
  456: 
  457:          {putenv, [<<"bad_key">>, <<"bad_value">>],[{1,".*"},{2,".*"}]},
  458:          {putenv, ["key", <<"bad_value">>]},
  459:          {putenv, [<<"bad_key">>, "value"]},
  460:          {putenv, ["abc=", "xyz"]},
  461: 
  462:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, ignore]},
  463:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, ignore]},
  464:          {set_signal, [bad_signal, bad_handling]},
  465:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, bad_handling],[{1,".*"},{2,".*"}]},
  466: 
  467:          {system_time, [bad_time_unit]},
  468:          {unsetenv, [{bad,key}]}
  469:         ],
  470:     error_info_lib:test_error_info(os, L).
  471: 
  472: sys_shell(Config) ->
  473:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  474:     SysShell = filename:join(DataDir, "sys_shell"),
  475: 
  476:     application:set_env(kernel, os_cmd_shell, SysShell),
  477: 
  478:     %% os:cmd should not try to detect the shell location rather than use
  479:     %% the value from kernel:sys_shell parameter
  480:     comp("sys_shell",os:cmd("ls")).
  481: 
  482: no_limit_for_opened_files() ->
  483:     case os:type() of
  484:         {unix, freebsd} ->
  485:             %% At least some FreeBSD systems support about one million open
  486:             %% files, which means that we run out of Erlang processes before we
  487:             %% reach the open file limit.
  488:             true;
  489:         {unix, _} ->
  490:             false;
  491:         _ ->
  492:             true
  493:     end.
  494: 
  495: %% Util functions
  496: 
  497: comp(Expected, Got) ->
  498:     case strip_nl(Got) of
  499: 	Expected ->
  500: 	    ok;
  501: 	Other ->
  502: 	    ok = io:format("Expected: ~ts\n", [Expected]),
  503: 	    ok = io:format("Got:      ~ts\n", [Other]),
  504: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  505:     end.
  506: 
  507: %% strips \n and \r\n from end of string
  508: 
  509: strip_nl([$\r, $\n]) -> [];
  510: strip_nl([$\n])      -> [];
  511: strip_nl([H|T])      -> [H|strip_nl(T)];
  512: strip_nl([])         -> [].
  513: 
  514: receive_all() ->
  515:     receive
  516: 	X -> [X|receive_all()]
  517:     after 0 -> []
  518:     end.
